channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Senate committee questions Mamdani's revocation of antisemitism order

item.title: Is Feminism Compatible With Christianity? Something Wicked Says Absolutely Not
item.description: Something Wicked asks us to take a step back and evaluate an ideology that pursues pure individual autonomy by trampling upon the lives of others.

item.title: Rocket CEO says U.S. mortgage industry is a ‘tale of two cities.’ His booming business shows a broader reality for American homebuyers
item.description: “Mortgage rates dropped to the lowest that they've been in the past three years,” Varun Krishna said, “and Rocket was right there to capitalize.”

item.title: Where Ice and ICE Meet
item.description: On the south side of Minneapolis, getting rid of the ice has a different meaning.

item.title: Top analyst Tom Lee on gold’s black swan risk: Elon Musk becoming ‘the new central bank’
item.description: "It all fits in a swimming pool, all the gold in the world," the Fundstrat head of research said. Plus, it's "extraterrestrial."

item.title: Overreliance on Renewables Leaves Americans Out in the Cold
item.description: Americans are at greater risk of power outages when we rely too much on wind, solar, and battery storage systems.

item.title: The Administration’s War on Drug Development
item.description: Capping drug companies’ prices and blocking their market access is the surest way to deter investment in medical innovation.

item.title: Mike ‘Pick Me’ Pence’s Opposition To The SAVE Act Is Dishonest And Constitutionally Illiterate

item.title: The Egregious Haitian-Immigration Decision
